intro: Marsdenia incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Marsdenia, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that mature into reddish-brown capsules, containing numerous seeds. Marsdenia incisa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
